alert.note: Alert for Gila River Valley; Southeast Yuma County; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:19PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Yuma County through 700 PM MST... At 617 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms near and south of Interstate 8 moving very slowly to the northwest. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hazardous conditions for motorists. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Somerton, Gadsden, Fortuna Foothills, San Luis, Wellton, Tacna, Ligurta and Araby. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 50. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 34. AZ Route 195 between mile markers 5 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Gila River Valley; Southeast Yuma County; Yuma
